definition[0]: to provide the money that someone needs for a business, a plan etc
example[0]: a software company bankrolled by the Samsung Group
definition[2]: to provide the money a person or company needs to operate a business, find new markets, develop new products etc
example[1]: Several banks pumped money into the business, bankrolling its expansion until it was floated on the stockmarket.
definition[3]: a supply of money for a particular purpose
example[2]: Credit Lyonnais could be one of his major backers for the project, providing a bankroll of $100 million or more.
definition[4]: a large amount of paper money rolled together
